text: Picking your brains: What would be your strategy when building a product listing page with a category filter based on data. Let’s say you have 1000 products. So naturally you can query those 1000 products and see how many categories are in use to build this category filter.
what's the best way to force an update after modifying a custom object that appears on a page?
the content is added via a GraphQL query
in this case waiting 30 seconds and refreshing worked lol
(pretty sure last time it took a while)

Something unrelated — but maybe also related -- Ive noticed some pretty hard caching of hubDB tables at the page level. To force the update on the page level you can typically just add or modify the page’s metadata and that will force a clean grab of the page and all of it’s associate data.
